messages.authorName: Liza, Noah, Cricket, and Lucy Gottlieb
messages.subject: Re: unschooling right this minute
messages.msgSnippet: This morning the girls watched Dora and Diego back to back from 9 until 2, and I taped it so we ll have it to watch when we go back to Maine (and no cable).
messages.messageBody:
This morning the girls watched Dora and Diego back to back from 9
until 2, and I taped it so we'll have it to watch when we go back to
Maine (and no cable). Noah (dh) cruised the internet learning about
jewel faceting. I went to Curves with my Mom, and on the way home
defended unschooling, just a bit, between deep breaths. My Dad
threw up a lot, having caught the virus Lucy and I had. Lucy took a
nap with Noah and Cricket and I played with her Barbie and did some
needlework crafting. I am just venturing into felt embroidery. I
love the look of it, but sequins and tiny beads and 2 & 4 yos makes
me sweat a little. But Cricket's great and loves all the crafty
things. Lucy woke, I made chocolate chip cookies that rock, and
Cricket put on a show for us (minus Dad) about Action Girl
(sometimes her, sometimes Barbie). Now Noah's reading a new bio on
Shakespeare, Mom and Dad are resting, the girls are playing (though
Lucy's heading this way), and I am getting caught up with you guys.
I love those Dropshots!!

Liza Rose in NC for a bit longer...

ps - we're visiting Greensboro until Feb. 1... any one out there
want to visit? mail me offlist... !!
